instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1989: What is A1989? A1989 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2018, 2019 with EMC 3124, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00850..
definitions.820-00850: What is 820-00850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1708: What is A1708? A1708 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2017, 2016 with EMC 3164, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00840, 820-00875..
definitions.A1706: What is A1706? A1706 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3071, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00239, 820-00923..
definitions.PP5V_G3S: What is PP5V_G3S? PP5V_G3S is a 5v power rail present when the system is in a G3S standby state.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MacBook Pro 13" Touch
threads.message:
I have the above board which had some water damage.  I've managed to get the board working and Mac OS loads fine. A lot of the liquid spilt onto the touch bar connector area especially J5100.

I couldn't find a replacement touchbar in the UK for the <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> but ordered one for the <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> which I believe should be compatible (they both have the same connectors and ribbon cable reference numbers.

When I attach the bar it lights up fine and I can adjust the settings fine from within system preferences>keyboard, however, it does not respond to touch.

I noticed that pin 22 of j5100 had corroded and had a crack and literally fell off. Pin 22 on j5100 is called <SIGNAL>PP5V_G3S_DFR_FILT</SIGNAL>.

My questions are is the fact that pin 22 is not connected the reason that the touch bar does not respond to touch or is it the fact that I'm using a touch bar from an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>. Checking the pin outs for both logic boards in my eyes produces a match and considering visually the bar does what it's supposed to I'm thinking damaged pin 22 is the problem.

Any help appreciated.

Thank you

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MacBook Pro 13" Touch
threads.message: The <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> does not have a touchbar, but the <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> does so I assume you mean that. Yes the touchbars should be compatible between the 2 models. Your issue is the connection to <SIGNAL>PP5V_G3S</SIGNAL> on J5100. Run a wire and it should fix it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MacBook Pro 13" Touch
threads.message:
Yes <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> apologies. I’ve ordered a replacement board connector as pin 22 in the connector has broken away. I will update here once I’ve changed it.
Thank you

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MacBook Pro 13" Touch
threads.message:
Removed Touch Bar board connector. Corroded pads repaired and replaced connector. All good now 
Thank you
